public class AboutDialog
extends javax.swing.JComponent

AboutDialog. A simple aboutDialog including system informations.

1.25, 22.05.2011

                   boolean modal,

Constructor.

Parameters:
owner - The Window from which the dialog is displayed.
modal - True for a modal dialog, false for non-modal dialog.
locale - Locale used for default title/description.
sortable - True - Columns are sortable, a JXTable will be used instead of JTable.

showDialog

public static void showDialog(java.awt.Window owner,
                              java.lang.String title,
                              java.lang.String description,
                              java.lang.String aboutText,
                              java.net.URL base,
                              java.util.Locale locale,
                              boolean sortable)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Convenient method to display dialog. Use null title to display the default title provided by resourceBundle. Use null description to display the default description provided by resourceBundle.

Parameters:
owner - The Window from which the dialog is displayed.
title - The dialog title.
description - The description at top of the dialog.
aboutText - The HTML supported about text.
base - The base URL used for HTML aboutText - can be null.
locale - Locale used for default title/description - can be null.
sortable - True - Columns are sortable, a JXTable will be used instead of JTable.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

createHyperlinkListener

protected javax.swing.event.HyperlinkListener createHyperlinkListener()
Creates a hyperlink listener for HTML based about text. The default implementation opens the URL by a browser.

setAboutText

public void setAboutText(java.net.URL document)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Setter for about text. Use this method to load HTML from an URL (e.g: resource within a jar file). For embedded images the image path is relative to the document location.

Parameters:
document - URL to the about text.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
